description.narrative: Professionals involved in child protection and justice have strengthened capacities for effective implementation and monitoring of child-friendly and gender-sensitive justice.

sector.narrative: Justice sector workforce strengthening and capacity building (including police)
Justice, birth registration/CRVS, and alternative care - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: Croatia Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Child Protection)
UNICEF Programmes in Croatia (Child Friendly Justice)
UNICEF Programmes in Croatia (Disaster Risk Reduction)
UNICEF Programmes in Croatia (Helping Child Regugees and Migrants)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Professionals involved in child protection and justice have strengthened capacities for effective implementation and monitoring of child-friendly and gender-sensitive justice.

description.narrative: With UNICEF's support in capacity building, positive trends in juvenile justice have continued. The fall in the number of children placed in closed correctional institutions (juvenile prison and closed reformatories) has continued and the share of alternative sanctions imposed on children in conflict with the law has increased. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/08/2020

title.narrative: Assessment standards for children at risk in social welfare and justice sector and availabilty of specialized training

baseline.value: Assessment standards are non-existing and the principle of the best interest of the child is not adhered to.Specialized training not available

target.value: 2021:The standards have been developed and continuous specialized training has been made available to advance practices and adhere to the principle of the best interest of the child.

actual.value: 2020:PCA for strengthening capacities of social welfare and justice system for assessment is currently underway.

title.narrative: Existence of specialized justice for children systems, such as capacity building and standards-setting within criminal and civil justice systems

baseline.value: Lack of systematic capacity building for justice and psychosocial professionals (juvenile judges, prosecutors and non-legal child professionals).

target.value: 2021:A specialized and systematic training has been made available through programmes organized by responsible institutions and academies for the professional training of justice and psychosocial professionals in contact with children.

actual.value: 2020:LoA signed with Judicial Academy and training curricula is being developed.
